metadata.description:
PyWake is an open-sourced and Python-based wind farm simulation tool developed at DTU capable of computing flow fields, power production of individual turbines as well as the Annual Energy Production (AEP) of a wind farm. The software solution provides an interface to both a selection different engineering models as well as CDF RANS (PyWakeEllipSys). It is highly efficient in calculating how the wak propagates within a wind farm and can quantify the interaction between turbines.

Source code repository (and issue tracker): https://gitlab.windenergy.dtu.dk/TOPFARM/PyWake

Documentation, installation, etc: https://topfarm.pages.windenergy.dtu.dk/PyWake.
metadata.title: DTUWindEnergy/PyWake: PyWake
